subject: Languages
title: William Stokoe Proves Sign Is a Real Language
description: One-minute skill: William Stokoe Proves Sign Is a Real Language.

hook.text: Until 1960, linguists dismissed sign language as mere gesture. One hearing professor proved them wrong.

buildup.text: William Stokoe was hired to teach English at Gallaudet University and became fascinated by ASL.

discovery.text: He proved ASL has phonology, morphology, and syntax â€” the same structural layers as spoken languages.

twist.text: His own deaf colleagues initially resented his research â€” they worried it would exploit ASL.

climax.text: Stokoe's 1960 paper launched sign language linguistics and changed how the world views deaf people.

punchline.text: One paper proved that millions of deaf people had been speaking a real language all along.

quiz.question: What did William Stokoe prove about ASL?
options: That it has the same linguistic structures as spoken languages
That it was invented in France
That it was simpler than English
That deaf people could hear through signing
